pullRequest.body:
We define order isomorphisms like `Fin.orderIsoTriple` from `Fin 3` to the finset `{a, b, c}` when `a < b` and `b < c`.

---

- [x] depends on: #21119

`+ orderIsoPair_zero`

<details>

```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
```

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

I am using `Finset` because this is what naturally appears in the future applications of this (in simplicial homotopy theory, typically `a`, `b` and `c` are going to be elements in another `Fin n`) and there it is convenient to be able to use `Finset.card`.
I have added TODOs to be file.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13072470652/job/36476956169)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13072470652/job/36476956441)

Thanks!

maintainer merge

Thanks!

bors r+

Thanks!

maintainer merge

What surprises me a bit is that we're doing this for `Finset`s and not `Set`s. I suppose we don't really have any machinery for constructing a finset, casting it to a set and then to a type, and asserting all of that is order isomorphic?

I have the feeling that the proofs are going to be annoying to generalize. If we stick with 1, 2, 3 it's going to be fine. But for 4 we'll end up copying and pasting most of the code. Wouldn't it be possible to break up the order iso into something like [`Fin.consOrderIso`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Fin/Tuple.html#Fin.consOrderIso), saying that we can extend an order iso between `Fin n` and a (fin)set `s` to `Fin (n + 1)` and `insert a s`, if `a` is smaller than everything in `s`?

On the other hand, perhaps I'm already too late with these suggestions. The code here is perfectly fine for its goals at the moment. So if you want this in Mathlib quickly, then I'm okay with merging if you can write some TODO items on the two notes above.

Thanks!

bors r+

Probably this one should be generalized
```suggestion
-- move to Mathlib.Order.Hom.Basic
@[simps!]
noncomputable def OrderIso.ofUnique
    (A B : Type*) [Unique A] [Unique B] [Preorder A] [Preorder B] :
    A â‰ƒo B where
  __ := Equiv.ofUnique A B
  map_rel_iff' {a b} := by simp

variable {Î± : Type*} [Preorder Î±] [DecidableEq Î±]

/-- This is the order isomorphisms from `Fin 1` to a finset `{a}`. -/
@[simps! apply]
noncomputable def orderIsoSingleton' (a : Î±) :
    Fin 1 â‰ƒo ({a} : Finset Î±) :=
  .ofUnique _ _
```
Thanks for the suggestion!

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
/-- This is the order isomorphism from `Fin 1` to a finset `{a}`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- This is the order isomorphism from `Fin 2` to a finset `{a, b}` when `a < b`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- This is the order isomorphism from `Fin 3`
```

```suggestion
## Future works

* Do the same for `Set` without too much duplication of code (TODO)
* Provide a definition which would take as an input an order
isomorphism `e : Fin (n + 1) â‰ƒo s` (with `s : Set Î±` (or `Finset Î±`)) and
extend it to an order isomorphism `Fin (n + 2) â‰ƒo Finset.insert i s` when `i < e 0` (TODO).

```

```suggestion

## Future works
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Order): order isomorphisms from `Fin n` for small `n`

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

What surprises me a bit is that we're doing this for `Finset`s and not `Set`s. I suppose we don't really have any machinery for constructing a finset, casting it to a set and then to a type, and asserting all of that is order isomorphic?

I have the feeling that the proofs are going to be annoying to generalize. If we stick with 1, 2, 3 it's going to be fine. But for 4 we'll end up copying and pasting most of the code. Wouldn't it be possible to break up the order iso into something like [`Fin.consOrderIso`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Fin/Tuple.html#Fin.consOrderIso), saying that we can extend an order iso between `Fin n` and a (fin)set `s` to `Fin (n + 1)` and `insert a s`, if `a` is smaller than everything in `s`?

On the other hand, perhaps I'm already too late with these suggestions. The code here is perfectly fine for its goals at the moment. So if you want this in Mathlib quickly, then I'm okay with merging if you can write some TODO items on the two notes above.

I am using `Finset` because this is what naturally appears in the future applications of this (in simplicial homotopy theory, typically `a`, `b` and `c` are going to be elements in another `Fin n`) and there it is convenient to be able to use `Finset.card`.
I have added TODOs to be file.
